qas.question: Beyonce did an interview with which magazine and was asked about feminism?
Beyonce supported which campaign that encourages leadership in girls?
Where was Beyonce quoted as saying that she is a modern-day feminist?
When did she say the she is a feminist?
What campaign did she contribute to?
What song did she release in 2013 in response to a speech?
Beyoncé used words from which Nigerian author in her song, Flawless?
Which campaign does Beyoncé contribute to that encourages leadership in females?

context: In an interview published by <a0_0><a2_0>Vogue<a2_0/><a0_0/> in <a3_0>April 2013<a3_0/>, Beyoncé was asked if she considers herself a feminist, to which she said, "that word can be very extreme... But I guess I am a modern-day feminist. I do believe in equality". She would later align herself more publicly with the movement, sampling "We should all be feminists", a speech delivered by Nigerian author <a7_0>Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie<a7_0/> at a TEDxEuston conference in April 2013, in her song "<a5_0>Flawless<a5_0/>", released later that year. She has also contributed to the <a1_0><a4_0><a8_0>Ban Bossy<a8_0/><a4_0/> campaign<a1_0/>, which uses television and social media to encourage <a6_0>leadership in girls<a6_0/>.
